title: Lion
description: A digital recreation and scaled down version of a male lion (Phantera leo). It is a large cat, native to the African continent, and India. It is a famous symbol in human culture, being used and depicted in sculptures, paintings, literature, movies and other forms of art and entertainment, going back as far as cave paintings. It is currently an endangered species, suspected to be the result of a combination of factors, including hunting, disease, and habitat loss.

title: Humpback Whale
description: A digital recreation and scaled down version of the Humpback Whale (Megaptera novaeangliae). This specie went thru a phase of endangerement due to the prevalence of the Whaling Industry, but has now recovered, following restrictions on hunting, and later a ban on commercial whaling, wich is followed by most of the world. They can be found around the worlds oceans, and they migrate to the poles for feeding on krill and fish, and to the subtropics to breed and give birth.

description: A scan and scaled version of the famous Greek statue Venus de Milo. The "Venus de Milo" or "Aphrodite de Melos" was rediscovered in the island of Milos, its from the Hellenistic era and dates to around the 2nd Century BC. It is currently in display at the Louvre Museum in Paris, France.
model: products/Venus de Milo/Venus de Milo Decimated.glb

title: Order of Christ Cross
description: The Order of Christ Cross is the insignia for the Military Order of Christ, the former Knights Templar order, reconstituted in Portugal after their abolishment in 22 March 1312. The insignia is also prevalent in Portuguese history and institutions, being famously used in the sails of their ships during the Era of Discoveries, and is still present in many flags and coat of arms in both Portgual and Brazil, in the badges of both national football teams, military insignias and the roundlets of Portuguese military aircrafts.

title: Winged Victory of Samothrace
description: A scan and scalled down version of monument to the Greek goddess Niké(Victory), originally rediscovered on the island of Samothrace, North of the Aegean Sea. This is considered a masterpiece of the Hellenistic Era, and it dates back to the 2nd Century BC.

title: Rodin's The Thinker
description: A scan of the famous statue "The Thinker" by Auguste Rodin, scaled down for printing.

title: Eagle
description: A model of a Bald Eagle (Haliaeetus leucocephalus), sitting on a piece of branch. It is a famous bird of prey from North America and an important symbol of the United States as well as several Native American cultures. This particular model was made without a base, and its suitable for those that wish to place it on a custom base, by means of glue or using the inserts present below.

title: Female Torso Esquiline
description: A digitalized, scaled down and truncated version of the Esquiline Venus, a Roman version of the goddess Aphrodites, from around the 1st Century AC. It was rediscovered in 1874 in Piazza Dante on the Esquiline Hill in Rome, and is likely part of one of the imperial gardens of the Horti Lamiani.
model: products/Female Torso Esquiline/Female Torso Esquiline Decimated.glb

description: A digital recreation of a rose.
